It happened at a fundraiser in Manhattan, where David Koch seemed to signal that he and his brother would like the Republican nominee in 2016 to be Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker. Here's Why!

The Koch brothers didn't just inherit their father's fortune. They also inherited his politics. In 1958, Fred Koch was a founding member of the John Birch Society, the right-wing extremist group that opposed civil rights and claimed that both the Democratic and Republican Parties were infiltrated by the Communist Party. In his 1960 self-published book, A Business Man Looks at Communism, Fred Koch wrote that "The colored man looms large in the Communist plan to take over America," and that welfare was a secret plot to attract rural blacks and Puerto Ricans to Eastern cities to vote for Communist causes and "getting a vicious race war started." The John Birch Society helped fuel a wave of hysteria against unions, civil rights groups, intellectuals, public schools, liberal clergy and others whom they considered a threat to America.

I agree with Martin that when you say a safety (strong safety, weak safety, free safety) has x number of I-N-TeeS, you are saying he has been credited with x number of INTerceptionS. (He may have made more eye-enn-tees, but the result of a play does not always survive. For example, if a cornerback had committed pass interference earlier in the play, the safety's INTerception will not count in his stats.)

However, I believe that in big-money football, with big coaching staffs, someone is keeping stats on every penalty committed by every player, and probably also keeping stats on catches that are nullified for any reason. These are not official stats according to the powers that be, but I'm fairly confident someone is keeping count.

I have mixed feelings on the tenure system:
(1) In 2011, I was appointed "Assistant Professor in Organic Chemistry" at the University of Alaska Fairbanks. My research specialty was no secret (organic materials chemistry). In 2012, the chair of the Chemistry Department there started saying that I should somehow change my research interests to "Alaska-relevant topics", such as biochemistry or environmental chemistry. I have no background or track record in those areas. In 2013, I was told that my contract would not be renewed beyond May 2014. Large numbers of students and some faculty protested, but neither the Dean nor the Chancellor would change their minds. The people who were hired to replace me have no post-graduate experience in organic chemistry. Instead, one is an environmental chemist and the other a biochemist. So much for teaching quality in a "right-to-work" state like Alaska.

(2) On the other hand, the phenomenon of the professor who sits on his or her behind after obtaining tenure is not fiction.

And so there are pluses and minuses to the tenure system.

There *are* some good psychics. But even they are by no means infallible and should be consulted judiciously and sparingly.

Choosing a psychic is like choosing any other service provider: consult others to find someone reliable and don't abandon your critical faculties.
